Subcategory: How important do you think it is to do this study in your community?
If this study did not involve an emergency, and we had time to consent you before treatment, what would be your decision to have your child participate?
Who do you think should be included in this community consultation process?
Who do you think would possibly benefit from this study?
How would you prefer to receive information about studies like this?
What are your thoughts about research trials that test medications to treat seizures?
How do you think this study might improve medical care for children with seizures?
What media or methods should be used to inform the community about the PediDOSE study?
If your child had a seizure and was included in this study, who would you have wanted the study team to talk to before this study was approved by the board?
What is your understanding about this study’s purpose?
Is there any reason, other than the qualifying criteria we have gone over, that you think someone should not be able to be enrolled without their permission?
Who should the study team need to hear from before presenting this study to the institutional review board that approves studies like this?

A minor CHILD/family member is having a seizure when the paramedics arrived to your home. He/she meets the qualifications to participate in the pedidose study. Would you agree to have him or her being included in the research study without your permission or your family's permission ahead of time?
What do you think are the benefits of doing research in emergency situations without a patient’s informed consent?
What concerns, if any, do you have about the random assignment of the ambulance agencies regarding when they switch to the new method of dosing?
What concerns do you have about starting research-related treatments in an emergency situation if you could not provide consent for yourself or on behalf of your child?
How do you feel about not having a choice about participation in the study?
If community consultation were not feasible, what other methods do you think we should use to gather feedback on how best to do emergency research like this?

In that moment, when a paramedic is getting ready to treat your child who is having a seizure, would you have been able to make an informed decision about whether or not to participate in a research study?
What are your fears or worries, if any, regarding the study?
Based on what you just heard, do you have any questions about WHAT we plan to do in this study?
Would you like to share any final comments or suggestions before I end the recording?
Tell me a little about your experience with seizures
Why do you feel that way, and are those reasons related to prior experiences you or others have had?
Do you have any questions after watching the video?
What do you think could be some of the challenges when doing research on emergency, time-sensitive conditions?

if this pedidose study enrolled ADULTS and then adult family member was having a seizure and he or she met the qualifications to participate in the study, would you agree if it was an adult in being consented or being enrolled without permission ahead of time?
Would you want somebody else to decide if your child could be a research subject?  If so, who?
What questions do you have about the study?
What, if anything, is there that could change regarding the details of this study to make you feel comfortable with being enrolled without your permission?
Do you have any questions about these regulations for emergency research?
What have you heard about the study so far that did not make sense?
Tell me about a time when you have had to call 9-1-1…?
Who would you want to make that decision, if you were unable and a family member or close friend (or other proxy mentioned) were not available in time?
What do you think researchers could do to promote respect for a patient’s decision making without getting informed consent?
What is your understanding about why the ambulance agencies will be randomly assigned to when they will switch methods of dose determination?
What had you heard about this study before today?
Do you have any questions about HOW we plan to do this study...?

if pedidose enrolled adults and YOU are having a seizure when paramedics arrived at your home, assuming you meet the study qualifications to participate, would you agree to be included in the research study, without your permission?

Would you want someone else besides a family member or close friend (or other proxy mentioned) to decide if your child could be a research subject?

What was your or your child’s experience like?
